Ward XP follows the same rules as minion XP, so it's split with nearby allies. Unless an ally expects you to leave lane entirely (XP radius is pretty large so that'd be a terrible play) that shouldn't be an issue.

Just a question regarding that:
Wouldn´t the "better" support (aka the one that wards more), get a XP disadvantage?
Simply because the enemy team has more wards to kill/get XP from?

Or is the XP amount so neglectable that that wouldnt matter?

Amount of XP's fairly small, so the vision advantage from such a circumstance should massively dominate the ward XP. Additionally number of wards someone's going to be able to kill in the first place is pretty restricted by ways to detect them (red trinket CD, Raptor buff, pink placement etc).
Well considering that if one support isn't warding well, do you really think he's going to actually buy a sweeper to get rid of the Sightstone wards?
I'm wondering this too, especially in low level play where people don't ward much. I usually only ever see the "debris" that shows where a ward used to be anyway.

What other ways are you looking to close the gap for support exp differences? These changes definitely help, but I don't think they're enough alone?

Adjustments to XP earned for champions significantly below the average level (normally supports), XP granted from champion kills near you when you're dead (supports, melee ones especially, often die first, which makes them more underleveled, which makes them die first even more).

If it was a minion instead, would it make him an ass too? If not, what is the difference?

you posted above as well, but not everyone plays support as a total "feed my adc/everyone else everything ever". It's literally 1 minion or less from the laner, but yes, if someone just stood there and waited for me to finish a ward I would be upset too. If everyone is helping to finish the ward asap I don't really care who gets the last hit, but if some guy is standing there just to steal it then I'd get frustrated too. It's a difference in intent - if your intent is just to clear vision and you happen to get the ward, I don't mind. But if you're sitting there specifically to attempt to steal gold from literally the single lowest gold income role in the entire game, you're a jerk.

I thought it was all about playing the game in a way that gives the highest chance of your team winning the match. Letting your midlaner or adc get as much gold as possible (be it through kills, cs, assissts, or wards - doesn't matter, gold is gold) is generally agreed to help achieve that goal.

Simple solution. Tie the ward kill XP to the Sightstone, as a passive. For instance:

Unique Passive: Destroying wards now grants you 30 experience points.

Suddenly, ADCs and Junglers won't care about stealing ward kills, and you won't be giving the entire enemy team an advantage because only sightstone users would gain the XP. Problem solved, and direct buff to supports.
